intro: Hemibaccharis irazuensis, commonly known as the Iratuz hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Costa Rica. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in montane regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its habitat.
